intro: Angelica lignescens, commonly known as the woody angelica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, and it produces dark brown, dry fruits. Angelica lignescens is often found in moist meadows and woodlands, and it has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
